intro: Haemadictyon acutifolium var. latifolium, commonly known as the broad-leaved hemadictyon, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, palmately lobed leaves that are broader than those of the typical variety. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite inflorescences, typical of the daisy family. It is native to certain regions of southern Africa and thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its unique leaf morphology, it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens.
